feed.title: Possible change to the MIT license

entry.title: Possible change to the MIT license
entry.summary: In this context, Damian Williamson expresses his opinion on the licensing of Bitcoin's software. He disagrees with any changes to the current MIT license, stating that it not only allows for the use of the software but also serves as a disclaimer for those involved in its release. Williamson believes that altering even a single word could have significant consequences if legal action is taken against anyone associated with the project. On the other hand, Cory Fields suggests that other projects should focus on copyright litigation and trademark dilution concerns while emphasizing the importance of Bitcoin's position.
